text: (upbeat music)

- Hi, I'm Sounil Yu, creator
of the Cyber Defense Matrix.

As a part of the shared
responsibility model,

it's important that workloads,
containers, applications,

databases, and other resources
that you run within AWS
have appropriate security measures.
Cloud workload protection platforms

provide host based protections
for these resources.
AWS Marketplace has several cloud workload

protection options for
your Amazon EC2 instances,

applications, databases,
and functions to help them

be properly secured against
a wide range of threats.
Cloud workload protection platforms
usually have an agent based component

and provide comprehensive
visibility and protection
at the host level.
These platforms offer protection
through an integrated set of features,

which commonly include
vulnerability scanning
of their operating system and containers,
host configuration and compliance checks,
host based network segmentation,
system integrity monitoring,

log management, application
control, exploit prevention,
memory protection, and many other
security hardening activities.
Cloud workload protection platforms

also integrate nicely
into your developer's

CICD pipelines so that
these scans and checks
are done automatically as a part of

your developer's build
and deployment processes.
These platforms also integrate well

with cloud security
posture management tools
that help you secure the infrastructure
that your workloads run on.

These capabilities can
enhance the security posture

of your workloads by
giving you greater control
over your workloads to help ensure

that they continue to meet
key compliance requirements.
